channel.title: What color scheme?
channel.description:
As few of you know I have lots of toys. This is the first one that shall recieve a paint job. I have an issue though, is this is what colors and style would contour this bike really well. I am trying to stay away from tribal as thats really common on this type of bike. Any ideas?
[IMG]http://i167.photobucket.com/albums/u152/T-Rev-07/ColorTouch-1.jpg[/img]
Edit - Yes this is a picture of my bike. I was at work when I took that picture.

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

If they say we can mix it Ill go wothout. Their mixer has been showing up high and drunk for a while now so base colors are a must there. I may look around though and see about a company I can ship the fairings to. Think im going to go with a single basic color for now though just foynd out im going to be laid off for 2-3 months.

Read full topic

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

CoonHunter:

I admit thats a beautiful color but i doubt the local paint shop (hour away, but the closest one) has it. I will definitely call and ask though. I just thought of an epic paint job though that id never be able to offored. Ill do a sketchy version when I get home.

I’m sure they could always order it/mix it if they had too, but its not the true Ducati orange, it definitely has a lot more yellow in it

Read full topic

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:


Hyosung calls it “Ducati Orange.” At least they did until they stopped offering it. It looks great outside, and even though it’s a plain color, it leaves a lot of room for artwork that goes with it.

As far as art goes, a subtle checkerboard theme would go nice

Read full topic

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

A friend of myn suggested I do. Medium blue. I was thinking put black rims with a medium blue stripe for the trim as well as a black logo kinda ghosted in. Along with ‘CoonHunter’ put where the ‘Katana’ sticker is. Not sure what font or how I’ll do the logo but Im going to start photoshoping today. Care to help me think lf a a funny yet memorable logo?

Offtopic - Clutch cable broke 2.days ago at my gf’s house. Gonna take 2 weeks to get a replavement. Guess its perfect time for paint. A friend of myn suggested I do. Medium blue. I was thinking put black rims with a medium blue stripe for the trim as well as a black logo kinda ghosted in. Along with ‘CoonHunter’ put where the ‘Katana’ sticker is. Not sure what font or how I’ll do the logo but Im going to start photoshoping today. Care to help me think lf a a funny yet memorable logo?

Offtopic - Clutch cable broke 2.days ago at my gf’s house. Gonna take 2 weeks to get a replavement. Guess its perfect time for paint.

Read full topic

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

CoonHunter:

The issue is I do not have the time to paint everything on a bike I am having as my first street bike. Especially a 95 that I plan to part out to others once I upgrade later on. I am looking for a decent idea that will look nice, be able to go to the KR rally’s and such without looking like a homo lol.

What about yellow with black flames?

Read full topic

Kidding.

I like simplicity. White black and blue are badass colors.
[/quote]
Yea, color choosing is not too hard. I just want to do a design Stupid me being picky and not wanting to go with stripes is going to cost me a ‘mint’.[/quote]

you aint pimpin without this

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

ziplock:

Remove awful 90’s katana decal.

Planned on it.

Anyways I guess if nobody has uncommon and unique idea in the next few days, Ill grab the sculpting tape. Just found out the local store has wrinkle black and a darker red paint. Prolly just spray the rims black and put down a gloss.

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

@Soulcist - Not an image but a design, snakeskin can be done with a fishing net and slight fading done by hand. Trying to stay away from stripes/tribals because its all to common.

@Andrew - lime green is getting more common as days go by. If I really wanted a single color it would be easily done with expensive spraypaint color and gloss with a little sandpaper.

Read full topic

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

In like 05 my dad had a lime green bike that looked like that, not sure if it was the exact bike but the color really looked good to me.

item.title: What color scheme?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:412274”]The bike came from the factory black and purple with blue and pink stickers.

I was almost thinking a gray and blue snakeskin design. Maybe where ‘Katana’ is put CoonHunter or Soharuda lol.[/quote]
You are wanting some kind of little image painted on it? And I suppose something like that wouldn’t hurt, care to find a little example?
